Good tips. The things I've found to be most important are plenty of water during and after drinking, making sure to eat enough before drinking, and replenishing electrolytes in the morning with gatorade or pedialyte. The thing about dehydration caused by drugs or alcohol is that drinking water alone will not solve the problem quickly. You'll get to a point where you're peeing clear, but you can tell you're still dehydrated. That's why electrolytes are so important.


Other than that, eat some food. Spicy food (if you like it and it won't make you vom) is good because capsaicin is a vasodilator, and I don't know why that helps, but it does in my experience.


And if none of that works, pop a xanax and you won't care how hungover you are anymore.

Instead of just water, try to eat/drink something salty too prior to sleep. If you're urinating a lot when drinking you're excreting water and electrolytes. By replacing just free water, you can cause an imbalance and actually worsen the ratio since more electrolytes will be pulled from your cells due to excess water presence.

The cheap and easy trick is gatorade or anything like that, but the sugar can potentially worsen a hangover too. Another cheap/easy thing that works is pickles. More expensive but less calories; salt tabs. I invested in salt tablets when I was running a marathon to combat dehydration. I no longer run marathons, but I continue to use salt tabs to use when I'm drinking. Def notice less of a hangover/speedier recovery.
